intro: Papaver atlanticum, commonly known as the Atlantic poppy, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the northeastern United States. It features striking, showy flowers with bright red petals and a prominent, saucer-shaped yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is characterized by its fibrous root system and its ability to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils.
